title: Trump uses anti-Semitic tropes to again criticize Jewish Americans
description: Former President Donald Trump, in a newly released interview, claimed that Jewish Americans "either don't like Israel or don't care about Israel," while also suggesting that evangelical Christians "love Israel more than the Jews in this country."

title: Ghislaine Maxwell confirms she won't testify in her sex trafficking trial
description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team rested its case in her sex trafficking conspiracy trial on Friday without Maxwell taking the stand to testify.

title: Ex-officer Kim Potter weeps on stand as she recalls fatally shooting Daunte Wright
description: Former police officer Kim Potter, who's said she mistook her firearm for her Taser when she fatally shot Daunte Wright during a traffic stop this year near Minneapolis, could take the stand Friday in her trial over the 20-year-old Black man's killing.

title: Cuba is reopening to the world. Many Cubans are seizing the chance to leave
description: Hours before the airline offices open for the day, hundreds of Cubans wait in line, hoping to snag a hard-to-find ticket off the island.

title: Man gets longest jail sentence handed out for a Capitol rioter so far
description: A Florida man who enthusiastically attacked police at the US Capitol on January 6 with a fire extinguisher, a wooden plank and a pole was sentenced to more than five years in prison on Friday, the longest sentence for a Capitol rioter thus far.

title: Julia Roberts crashed George Clooney's appearance on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!'
description: Julia Roberts delivered the ultimate photo bomb while George Clooney was appearing virtually on "Jimmy Kimmel Live!"

title: Remaining missionaries kidnapped in Haiti released by gang, says justice minister
description: The remaining 12 hostages kidnapped by an armed gang in Haiti two months ago were released Thursday, according to the country's justice minister Berto Dorcé.

title: Look back on the biggest stories of 2021
description: CNN takes a look back over the biggest stories of the year of 2021, focusing on some of the shocking, surprising, and optimistic numbers they've produced.

title: Spider interrupts Australian news conference
description: A huntsman spider interrupted Queensland's health minister as she held a briefing on the Covid-19 situation across the state.

title: From student protester to leftist hero: The shaggy-haired millennial vying for Chile's presidency
description: Just ten years ago, Gabriel Boric was a student leader in the Chilean capital, rallying against the country's privatized education system alongside thousands of other students in Santiago.

title: Russia lists demands while amassing more troops near Ukraine's border
description: Russia has continued to amass new troops near Ukraine's border in recent days, despite President Joe Biden urging Russian President Vladimir Putin to de-escalate tensions during a virtual meeting last week.

title: Chris Noth Peloton ad suspended after sexual assault allegations
description: Peloton has pulled an ad featuring Chris Noth in the wake of sexual assault allegations against him.

title: Trump admin. deliberately undermined Covid response, House report says
description: Trump administration officials made "deliberate efforts to undermine the nation's coronavirus response for political purposes," a House oversight committee led by Democrats said in a report released Friday.

title: John King: Trump valued reelection over American lives
description: A House oversight committee report reveals that the Trump administration made deliberate efforts to undermine the nation's Covid-19 response. CNN's John King joins New Day to discuss.

title: 'The Matrix Resurrections:' First reactions are in
description: Which pill will you take, love it or hate it?

title: Louisiana judge faces calls to resign over racist video recorded at her home
description: A judge in Lafayette, Louisiana, is taking a leave of absence and facing calls for her resignation after a video with racist language recorded at her home surfaced. CNN's Ryan Young reports.

title: Czech center-right government takes office amid price rises and a Covid wave
description: Czech Prime Minister Petr Fiala's new center-right government took office on Friday facing soaring inflation and energy costs, record budget deficits and the dragging Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Zoom Santas are back and eager as ever
description: "We're about to be joined by a very important customer," said Christian Braun, CEO of collectible e-commerce company HobbyDB, during a recent Zoom meeting with his marketing team. "Over to you, Nick."

title: Inflation is bad enough. One country is making it even worse
description: Unnerved by surging prices, the Bank of England on Thursday became the first major central bank to hike interest rates since the pandemic began. The US Federal Reserve will follow in the coming months, with three rate hikes expected next year.

title: A Covid-19 'viral blizzard' is about to hit the US, expert says
description: With Covid-19 hospitalizations rising as the holiday season gets into full swing, experts are urging people to take precautionary measures against a new variant that may quickly sweep the nation.

title: Two sets of twin boys die in London house fire after being left home alone
description: A 27-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of child neglect and remains in police custody after four young boys died in a house fire in Sutton, south London, the city's Metropolitan Police said Friday.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez reveal sex of unborn twins with adorable family video
description: Cristiano Ronaldo and his pregnant partner, Georgina Rodriguez, have revealed the sex of their unborn twins in a video that is likely to warm millions of hearts just in time for Christmas.

title: Australian Open organizers confirm medical exemption process
description: Australian Open tournament director Craig Tiley said players applying for a medical exemption to participate in the grand slam without being vaccinated against Covid-19 will have their case reviewed by an independent three-person panel.

title: Fox's worst week? Dominion ruling adds to drumbeat of bad news for the network
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: London bars and restaurants are shutting themselves down as Omicron rips through UK
description: As the Omicron variant sweeps through the United Kingdom, pushing daily coronavirus infections to their highest level on record, British businesses are shutting their doors again — but not because of government instructions.

title: In Alabama, Brooks looks to redeem himself with Trump amid campaign struggles
description: Just before Donald Trump took the stage at an August rally in Alabama that was meant to boost GOP Rep. Mo Brooks' US Senate bid, the former President ran into one of Brooks' primary opponents offstage.

title: Voters give scandal-hit UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson 'a kicking' with special election loss
description: Boris Johnson's Conservatives on Friday lost control of a parliamentary seat they have dominated for nearly 200 years, ratcheting up the pressure on Johnson from his lawmakers, who are in mutinous mood after a series of crises and scandals.

title: Red Bull Racing boss Christian Horner says right decision was made in F1 title decider as he praises 'absolutely outstanding' Max Verstappen
description: Red Bull Racing team principal Christian Horner says the decision to allow racing on the last lap of Sunday's Abu Dhabi Grand Prix was "the right thing."

title: Ex-Trump aide's text to Meadows
description: Former Trump communications director Alyssa Farah speaks to CNN's Alisyn Camerota about the text she sent to former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows on January 6.

title: Details paint Trump's coup attempt in horrifying new light
This major Chinese property developer may have just lost $313 million
description:
• China was already facing an economic slowdown in 2022. Now here comes Omicron
• US adds drone maker DJI and 7 other Chinese companies to investment blacklist

title: Analysis: Omicron battle in the US brings delicate questions
description: The Omicron winter is coming.

title: These older backpackers want you to stop delaying your travel dreams
description: For Kristy Burns, her partner Annette Demel and close friend Lynn Edminston, hitting their 50s and 60s marked a beginning, not an end.

title: The moments that defined golf in 2021
Israeli man killed in West Bank after shooting attack on car
description: An Israeli man has died in a shooting in the West Bank, according to the Israeli army and emergency responders.

title: Vaccinations alone won't slow Omicron. Here's everything we know about the variant
description: • Covid 'viral blizzard' is about to hit the US

title: Up to 27 feared dead in building fire in Japan
description: Up to 27 people are feared dead after a fire broke out in a building in Osaka, Japan, according to the Osaka Fire department.

title: The world could burn a record amount of coal next year despite efforts to scrap the dirtiest fossil fuel
description: Rising consumption in China, India and the United States could bring global coal-fired power demand to a new all-time high this year, undermining efforts to cut greenhouse gas emissions, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Friday.

title: Covid-19 fears behind shock Women's Champions League exit, says Chelsea's Emma Hayes
description: Chelsea manager Emma Hayes said fears about a possible Covid-19 outbreak in the squad affected her team's performance in their 4-0 Women's Champions League defeat at Wolfsburg on Thursday.

title: The pandemic forced Kim Jong Un into retreat. The world should brace for his resurgence
description: Ten years ago, the world watched as a young Kim Jong Un solemnly walked beside his father's hearse on a snowy morning in Pyongyang as distraught North Koreans wailed in grief.

title: A former accountant is now turning heads in the fashion world
description: Accountant Shamyra Moodley was on maternity leave after the birth of her son when she came up with an idea that would push her into the world of fashion.

title: Tens of thousands evacuate as Super Typhoon Rai makes landfall in the Philippines
description: Tens of thousands of people have evacuated their homes in the Philippines as the archipelago braces for Super Typhoon Rai, known locally as Odette, which is expected to pass through the southern and central portions of the country on Thursday afternoon.

title: Miss World 2021 postponed after 23 contestants test positive for Covid-19
description: This year's Miss World competition, scheduled to take place Thursday in Puerto Rico, has been postponed after multiple people linked to the event -- including 23 of the 97 contestants -- tested positive for Covid-19.

title: How two Florida moms spearheaded a parent movement aiming to impact the 2022 elections
description: Tucked away in the back of an office in a Florida strip mall is a tidy storage room filled with hundreds of navy blue t-shirts, hats, flags and even Christmas decor.

title: Gun industry stakeholders sue NY attorney general over state public nuisance gun law
description: More than a dozen gun industry stakeholders sued the New York State Attorney General, challenging the constitutionality of a state public nuisance law that allows gun manufacturers and distributors to be sued if their products are used in crimes by third parties.

title: Judge overturns Purdue Pharma's $4 billion opioid settlement, clearing path for civil suits
description: A federal judge has overturned the opioid settlement of more than $4 billion that gave the Sackler family broad protection against civil litigation and resolved all outstanding civil suits against OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma.

title: Biden warns of 'winter of severe illness and death' for unvaccinated
description: CNN's Michael Smerconish weighs in on rising Covid-19 cases in the US as stores, sports, schools and Broadway stages scramble to deal with the virus's impact.

title: 9 reasons to visit Chengdu when China reopens
description: While China still hasn't announced solid plans to reopen its border to international leisure travelers, there's no harm in starting to dream about your next visit now.

title: Kim Jong Un marks 10 years as North Korea's leader
description: CNN's Paula Hancocks takes a look at the rule of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, 10 years after the death of his father, Kim Jong Il.

title: Analysis: The US isn't ready for what's coming next from the Supreme Court
description: • Analysis: Details paint Trump's coup attempt in horrifying new light

title: Extinct supervolcano may hold largest lithium deposit in the world
description: CNN's Rene Marsh travels to Nevada, home to a lithium-rich extinct supervolcano, to see how the rush to procure critical minerals in the United States is pitting environmental advocates against each other.
